alert.note: Alert for Abbeville; Anderson (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 26 at 9:51PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Elbert, southeastern Anderson and Abbeville Counties through 1030 PM EDT... At 951 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles east of Elberton, or near Lake Russell, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Abbeville, Elberton, Calhoun Falls, Due West, Lake Secession, Lowndesville, Russell State Park, Middleton, Lake Russell and Antreville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
